title: Explore your R Libraries
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(libminer)  libsummary() #>                                                                 library #> 1                                    C:/Program Files/R/R-4.3.1/library #> 2                        C:/Users/kbirs/AppData/Local/R/win-library/4.3 #> 3 C:/Users/kbirs/AppData/Local/Temp/Rtmp4u9Op7/temp_libpath4ad42af04828 #>   n_packages #> 1         30 #> 2         98 #> 3          1 #also can calculate sizes #libsummary( sizes = TRUE) summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00
